Key Match Events: Andrés Giménez singled home José Ramírez from second base in the 10th inning as the Cleveland Guardians clinched a playoff berth with a 3-2 win over the Minnesota Twins.
Cleveland posted their major league-leading 42nd comeback win and second straight in extra innings.
Eli Morgan got out of a bases-loaded jam in the 10th inning by retiring Carlos Correa on a foul pop and Byron Buxton on a liner to right.
Rookie Kyle Manzardo homered for the Guardians.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrés Giménez said, 'That's us. That's the Cleveland Guardians.'
First-year manager Stephen Vogt said, 'The goal is to get in. You get in, you have a chance.'
Minnesota's Matt Wallner said, 'They’re the best bullpen in the league for a reason and they show that every time.'
Austin Hedges praised manager Stephen Vogt, saying, 'He’s one of the most special humans I’ve ever met, not just as a manager but as a man.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's bullpen combined for 5 2/3 hitless innings.
Cleveland lowered the magic number to clinch the AL Central title to three.
The Twins fell into a tie with Detroit for the final wild card spot.
Cleveland took control of the division in mid-April and has had sole possession of first place for all but one day the past five months.
Kyle Manzardo is batting .357 with four home runs and seven RBIs in 16 games since being recalled from Triple-A Columbus on Sept. 1.
Others: Guardians' RHP Alex Cobb will pitch a simulated game at Triple-A Toledo in his next step in returning to the rotation.
Steven Kwan is making progress after going on the IL earlier this week and is eligible to return on Sept. 24.
Twins will open a three-game series in Boston on Friday with David Festa starting.
Guardians will head to St. Louis for their last three road games of the regular season with Ben Lively starting against Kyle Gibson.
